intro: Parosela uncifera, commonly known as the slender parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
